In the past, ISCTE-IUL was named ''Instituto Superior de CiÃªncias do Trabalho e da Empresa'' abbreviated ''ISCTE'' (in [[English language|English]] ''Higher Institute of Business and Labour Sciences'').
==Schools== ISCTE-IUL is constituted by four [[University college|schools]]:<ref>[http://dre.pt/pdf2sdip/2010/11/212000000/5433354333.pdf ISCTE â INSTITUTO UNIVERSITÃRIO DE LISBOA, DeliberaÃ§Ã£o n.Âº 1971/2010, DiÃ¡rio da RepÃºblica, 2.Âª sÃ©rie â N.Âº 212 â 2 de Novembro de 2010.]</ref> * ISCTE-IUL Business School (IBS) * School of Social and Human Sciences (ECSH) * School of Sociology and Public Policy (ESPP) * ISCTE-IUL School of Technology and Architecture (ISTA)
==Teaching Programmes== ISCTE-IUL comprises about 7,500 [[student]]s at both undergraduate and graduate levels and close to 400 [[professor]]s. The ISCTE - Lisbon University Institute confers all levels of [[academic degree]]s in [[Anthropology]], [[Sociology]], [[History]], [[Social psychology]], [[Political Science]], [[Urban planning|Planning]], [[Architecture]], [[Economics]], [[Finance]], [[Business administration]] and [[Management]], [[Human Resources]], [[Marketing]], [[Computer Science]], [[Telecommunications Engineering]], [[Industrial Engineering]], amongst many other post-graduate programs.
==History== [[File:Iscte.jpg|thumb|Former logo of the ISCTE-IUL.]] ISCTE-IUL was established in Lisbon in 1972 as ISCTE<ref>The ISCTE-IUL was created by the [http://www.dre.pt/pdf1sdip/1972/12/29000/19461950.PDF Decreto-Lei nÂº 522/72, of 15th December 1972 (pdf file)].</ref> using the faculty and facilities of the ''Instituto de Estudos Sociais'' (Institute of Social Studies, founded in 1963) as a first step towards a new and innovative public university in Lisbon. Its present designation dates from 2009.
From its creation ISCTE-IUL was authorized to grant the [[bachelor's degree]] and the [[Licentiate#Portugal|licenciatura degree]], which was granted after completion of a four to five years long program that often required writing a final dissertation and thus was roughly equivalent to the current [[master's degree]], instituted as part of the [[Bologna process]]. From 1983 onwards, ISCTE-IUL was also authorized to grant the master's degree, which was higher than the current [[Bologna process]] master's degree but still lower than a [[doctorate degree]]).
What was to be the first college of a never completed larger projected university (due to the [[carnation revolution]] of 1974) always remained as a non-integrated University Institute - situation that was institutionalized in 1988. From that date onwards, ISCTE-IUL grants all academic degrees, comprising [[Bachelor]]s, [[Master's degree|Master]]s, [[PhD]]s, [[Honorary doctorate]]s and [[Habilitation]]s (called ''AgregaÃ§Ã£o'' in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]).
ISCTE-IUL is today part of both the [[FundaÃ§Ã£o das Universidades Portuguesas]] (Foundation of Portuguese Universities) and the [[Conselho de Reitores das Universidades Portuguesas]] (Council of [[Rector]]s of the Portuguese Universities). It is also one of the few public universities in Portugal with a [[Private Foundation|foundational nature]],<ref>Decreto-Lei n.Âº 95/2009.</ref> together with the [[University of Porto]] and the [[University of Aveiro]].
